about.title: About Ezhumi
about.subtitle: Your journey from registration to innovation starts here
about.wakeUpCall: Ezhumi isn't just a word. It's a wake-up call.
about.callToAction: A call for students to rise, build, and make a difference.
about.description1: The title represents the rise of innovation in agriculture, the empowerment of farmers, and the growth of sustainable solutions for society.
about.description2: With an expected participation of 150+ teams and 150+ unique ideas, it is aimed at empowering innovators, students, and future entrepreneurs to solve real-world agricultural challenges through technology and innovation.
about.incubationInfo: The top 7 solutions will be incubated in our EIDC (Entrepreneurship & Innovation Development Cell), giving them the necessary mentorship and resources to create a tangible impact.

themes.title: Problem Statements
themes.subtitle: Choose your challenge and build innovative solutions

problems.title: AI-Powered Crop Disease Detection
problems.description: Farmers struggle to detect crop diseases early. Design an AI-powered image processing tool that identifies diseases, weeds, and pest damage in real time.

problems.title: Pest Outbreak Prediction System
problems.description: Pest outbreaks reduce yields unpredictably. Create an AI tool that predicts outbreaks from weather and imaging data and suggests preventive measures.

problems.title: Smart Irrigation Valve System
problems.description: Manual irrigation wastes water. Build a smart valve system that auto-controls irrigation based on soil moisture data.

problems.title: Low-Cost Micro-Irrigation System
problems.description: Micro-irrigation systems are costly and complex. Develop a low-cost digital micro-irrigation prototype for precise watering.

problems.title: Saline Soil Reclamation Solution
problems.description: Saline soils reduce productivity. Create affordable, farmer-friendly solutions to reclaim salt-affected soils.

problems.title: AI Groundwater Exploration Tool
problems.description: Groundwater exploration is uncertain. Build an AI/ML model that predicts well viability, depth, and quality using geodata.

problems.title: Climate Shock Warning System
problems.description: Farmers face climate shocks like droughts and floods. Develop AI and satellite-based systems for early warnings and adaptive crop recommendations.

problems.title: Farm Pollution Monitoring System
problems.description: Farmers are unaware of pollution risks. Design a system to monitor air and water quality in farm regions and send timely alerts.

problems.title: Cold Storage Monitoring System
problems.description: Cold storage failures cause huge losses. Build a sensor-based system for real-time monitoring and management of cold storage and transport.

problems.title: Tomato Thermal Storage Unit
problems.description: Tomatoes spoil quickly after harvest. Design a thermally controlled storage unit that extends tomato shelf life.

problems.title: Natural Banana Ripening Chamber
problems.description: Banana ripening is often done using harmful chemicals. Develop a low-cost, safe, and natural ripening chamber for bananas to improve quality and farmer income.

problems.title: Solar Crop Residue Converter
problems.description: Crop residues are often burned. Develop modular, solar-powered units that convert residues into compost, bioenergy, or biodegradable packaging.

problems.title: Advanced Jaggery Production Unit
problems.description: Jaggery units lack hygiene and efficiency. Build advanced infrastructure and mechanization for cleaner jaggery production.

problems.title: Milk Quality Testing Device
problems.description: Milk adulteration is common. Create a compact device that quickly tests fat, SNF, protein, and adulteration in milk.

problems.title: Rapid Commodity Quality Tester
problems.description: Farmers face delays and uncertainty in verifying commodity quality at procurement. Develop a rapid, affordable device to test the quality of agricultural commodities during procurement.

problems.title: Rice Mold Detection Biosensor
problems.description: Rice grains are often infested with molds during storage. Create a low-cost, biosensor-based device to detect fungal contamination in stored rice early.

mechanization.title: Farm Mechanization, Automation, and Inclusive Tools

problems.title: AI-Powered Farm Robots
problems.description: Farm labor shortages increase costs. Develop AI-powered robots or drones for planting, harvesting, spraying, and crop monitoring.

problems.title: Mini Tiller for Clay Soils
problems.description: Heavy clay soils make tilling tough. Create a cost-effective mini tiller and leveling machine.

problems.title: Compact Paddy Harvester with Dryer
problems.description: Paddy harvesting and drying are inefficient. Design a compact harvester with integrated precision drying for in-field use.

problems.title: Adaptive Farming Tools
problems.description: Differently-abled farmers face barriers. Invent adaptive tools that enable mobility- or vision-impaired farmers to work independently.

problems.title: Poultry Heat Stress Controller
problems.description: Poultry birds suffer from heat stress. Create an affordable device that maintains optimal 35°C in poultry farms automatically.

problems.title: Smart IoT Greenhouse Controller
problems.description: Greenhouses are often mismanaged. Build a smart IoT greenhouse controller with sensors and a mobile app.

problems.title: Palmyra Tree Climbing Device
problems.description: Farmers face risk and difficulty climbing palmyra trees to collect sap. Develop a safe, low-cost mechanical climbing device for tapping palmyra trees.

problems.title: Tapioca Harvesting Machine
problems.description: Harvesting and cleaning tapioca roots is labor-intensive and inefficient. Create a cost-effective machine to harvest and clean tapioca roots.

knowledge.title: Farmer Knowledge, Market, and Research Support

problems.title: Mobile E-Learning Platform
problems.description: Farmers lack access to training. Develop a mobile-based e-learning platform for sustainable farming practices.

problems.title: Temple Tree Conservation System
problems.description: Ancient temple trees are at risk of dying, threatening cultural and ecological heritage. Develop a device or genetic testing protocol to detect live cells in Sthalaviruksha trees for propagation and conservation.

problems.title: Blockchain Crop Certificate System
problems.description: Food fraud erodes trust. Design a blockchain-based crop certificate system with QR codes for authenticity verification.

problems.title: Blockchain Fair-Trade Marketplace
problems.description: Farmers earn less due to middlemen. Build a blockchain-based fair-trade marketplace connecting farmers directly to consumers.

problems.title: Digital Credit Rating System
problems.description: Farmers struggle to get loans. Create a digital credit rating system using farm history and microclimate data.

problems.title: Equipment Sharing Platform
problems.description: Machinery is unaffordable for smallholders. Create a digital platform where farmers can rent or share expensive equipment.

eventFlow.question: What is the event flow of Ezhumi?
eventFlow.answer:
• Round 1: Online Project Submission – Open to all students & innovators (No entry fee).
• Jury Evaluation – Projects shortlisted based on innovation & creativity.
• Top 50 Teams Selection – Jury will select the best 50 teams.
• Boot camp + Finals – The 50 selected teams will attend the Boot camp and directly pitch in the Finals (Boot camp fee applicable).

teamSize.question: How many members can be in a team?
teamSize.answer: A team can have 2 to 4 members.

problemStatements.question: How many problem statements will be given?
problemStatements.answer: Each team will work on only one problem statement.

pitchDuration.question: What is the time duration for the final pitch?
pitchDuration.answer: Every team will get 10 minutes to present their solution.

round1Participation.question: Who can participate in Round 1?
round1Participation.answer: Any college student or innovator can participate in the first round.

registrationFee.question: Is there any entry/registration fee?
registrationFee.answer:
• Round 1 (Online Submission): Free
• Bootcamp (Top 50 Teams): Fee applicable

bootcampRegistration.question: Who can register for the Bootcamp?
bootcampRegistration.answer: Only the Top 50 selected teams will register and attend the Bootcamp + Finals.

certificates.question: Will participation certificates be given?
certificates.answer: Yes, participation certificates will be given to all teams attending the Bootcamp.

multipleTeams.question: Can a participant join more than one team?
multipleTeams.answer: No, a participant can be part of only one team.

winnerSelection.question: How will winners be selected in the Finals?
winnerSelection.answer: Judges will evaluate based on innovation, clarity, impact, and presentation skills.
